title: Bigcommerce $3BN in orders processed
name: bigcommerce
description: The leader in e-commerce for SMBs. $75M in VC, 300 employees, $3BN in orders processed.
problem: Below industry standard cart to pay conversion rates
solution: Improve cart to pay conversion rates by improving site performance and reliability, implement industry best practices and standards, and iterate on customer feedback. Integrate the most popular payment providers amongst customers to allow for the greatest flexibility and ease of transaction.
hardestChallenge: Integrating Paypal Express SDK to fit all of the user stories and edge cases
leadership: Work with scrum team in San Francisco and Sydney Australia

title: Challengr
name: challengr
description: Challengr is a social app where you can challenge your friends to complete the tasks that are long overdue and help them achieve their goals.
problem: Working in an scrum methodology to administer product development. The importance of preserving a maintainable, scalable, and consistent codebase
solution: Lead technical training to fellow engineers in topics including Sass, flexbox, React Native, and Angular. Spearheaded refactoring sessions, code reviews, daily stand up’s, and white board sessions throughout application development
hardestChallenge: Mobile: Integrating Paypal Braintree SDK into React Native. Web: Analyzing and implementing the most efficient method to grant the application data to respond in real-time through polling and websockets

process.description: Used Sketch to construct prototypes of application. Analyzed and dismantled prototypes on multiple iterations for improvement. Architected connections between modules and overall flow of the application.

Screenshots on left-hand side is the application at its MVP state. Screenshots on right-hand side is the application after deconstruction of user interface. The application needed to be more intuitive. This was solved by exhibiting a short video of application related content at the login and signup page. Allowing the user to generate assumptions of the application intended use thus leading to an enhanced user experience. Constructed a simpler interface to draw more attention to certain items and control the user's actions to be aligned with the application’s intended routes. Add subtle animation to promote a responsive user experience.

Development workflow system was to get a feature visualized and working as fast as possible. Then consider optimization techniques and methods, weigh the pros and cons of each one, and iterate for improvement. Utilized Angular to build the services, factories, filters, and custom directives of the web application.

The graph represents the modular architecture used to develop for both iOS and android OS efficiently. Keeping the code DRY, only necessary to switch out OS specific components such as the React Native Navigator and NavigatorIOS component.
Screenshots of ios version of application, built in react native to support both android and ios versions using 85% cross-platform compatible components.

Utilized Socket.io for real-time communication with connected devices mobile and web. Integrated with third-party service providers such as Braintree to supply user payments. Established continuous integration build process. Utilized Node and Express to provide an API which both web and mobile applications could connect to. Wrote performant MySQL raw queries when necessary and utilized the Sequelize ORM for common queries.

title: Empowering students through their college career
name: gradassist
description: GradAssist is a mobile application that allows students to manage their academic information more efficiently
hardestChallenge: Manipulating and presenting large data sets. Developed data-driven iOS application
problem: College students don't have a reliable portable tool to stay on track to graduate as quickly as possible
solution: GradAssist provides undergraduate college students with an easy to use portal that clearly displays all of the information students need most. This information includes: what courses they have completed, what courses they must take in order to graduate with their intended major and minor as well as various statistics informing students of their current academic status

process.description: Design begins with pen and paper to maintain simplicity and focus on essential components. Built hi-fi mock-ups and prototypes utilizing Photoshop and Sketch.
Several prototype iterations made after receiving user feedback.
Grunt, HTML5, jQuery, Javascript used to build a promotional website to attract new customers and to spread the word of product launch.

Mobile iOS application built in both Objective-C and Swift. MBAAS Built.io utilized for quick and rapid development without the overhead of worry about backend operations. Utilized PaintCode for quickly transforming designs into Objective-C code.

title: Global e-commerce hat retail and wholesale
name: riverz
description: San Francisco Hat Company produces hats locally and sells them worldwide
problem: Revamp the design and user experience of multiple brand websites
solution: Research and implement e-commerce CMS platforms that better suite the company. Design and developed e-commerce website utilizing Prestashop CMS which increased online sales by 15%
hardestChallenge: Analysis and evaluation of Prestashop CMS design and architecture

process.description: Develop a responsive website optimized for all screen sizes including desktop, tablet, and mobile. Manual testing was conducted with multiple online tools, which followed with many iterations.

Implemented Sass into workflow and trained fellow engineers of it’s benefits. It's extremely important to modularize and refactor Sass styles consistently, preferably in parallel of refactoring any other code. Sass and CSS styles get out of hand very quickly as your project grows so it's vital to constantly refactor and re-organize your Sass otherwise it will be a nightmare to maintain or scale the app.

Maintained knowledge of technical advances and evaluated existing software for company use. Previous website CMS used Drupal v4.7. Prestashop operates on a MVC 3-tier architecture which uses Smarty (PHP templating engine) for its View. Engineered responsive prototypes using Jekyll. After completing final prototypes, it was integrated into Prestashop allowing the company to run all of its online business from the CMS.

title: Web Agency servicing hundreds of business websites
name: sinosolutions
description: Sino Solutions is a web development agency servicing hundreds of unique businesses based in Beijing China.
problem: Design and deliver clean, high quality functional websites. Each website is tailored for a specific audience and has multiple complex requirements. Develop websites within the given time frame that represents all aspects of the company.
solution: Collaborate with web-designers to create mockups, logos, and brochures. Develop dynamic html websites from hi-fi design requirements. Used SinoSolutions custom Content Management System to provide clients with custom customization. Coordinated with multilingual design team to establish client driven designs in Photoshop
hardestChallenge: Managing working in a high paced environment and the ability to work on multiple project against deadlines.

process.description: Collaborated with multiple graphic designers and web developers to build websites suited for individual clients. Developed front-end along with content in Chinese and then integrated it into the custom built Content Management System

Collaborated with Chinese graphic designers to improve and make updates to photoshop webpage mockups. Utilized search engine optimization (SEO) techniques and strategies such as auditing site performance, optimizing landing page, and testing and iterating a mobile-friendly website.

title: Isofit
name: isofit
problem: Online booking system integration, including implementing an online client booking system and teaching staff how to input data and operate the online booking system.
solution: Front-desk operation, including learning and completing all of the tasks necessary for the smooth operation of the front-desk of a client-based business and teaching and training other staff.
hardestChallenge: Communicate with and train our other staff members web management techniques in Chinese.

process.description: Website design, implementation and management, including operation of the website back-end, liaison with web-hosting service providers and ensuring content was created and updated on a regular basis.
